titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alexander Lmanian, Photographs of Washington, D.C., and New Haven, Connecticut
Lmanian (Alexander) Photographs of Washington, D.C., and New Haven, Connecticut
titlestmt.author: by Matthew D. Mason

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:12

did.unittitle: Photographs of Washington, D.C., and New Haven, Connecticut.

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Photographs created by Alexander Lmanian that document locations and events in Washington, D.C., and its vicinity, 1964-1968, as well as New Haven, Connecticut, 1968-1969. The images of Washington document the physical impact of riots on the city following the assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr., April 4-8, 1968.
did.physdesc: 745 negatives : film, b & w ; 5.7 x 5.7 cm. and smaller.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from the William Reese Co. on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2007.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Restricted Fragile in box 1 may be consulted only with permission of the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Alexander Lmanian, Photographs of Washington, D.C., and New Haven, Connecticut is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alexander Lmanian, Photographs of Washington, D.C., and New Haven, Connecticut. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Digital surrogates for all of the images in this collection are available through Digital Images Online database of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Alexander Lmanian (1925-1996) was a sergeant in the United States Army in World War II, and after the war became a stringer photographer for the New Haven Register newspaper and the Associated Press.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of photographs created by Alexander Lmanian that document locations and events in Washington, D.C., and its vicinity, 1964-1968, as well as New Haven, Connecticut, 1968-1969.

Images of Washington document the physical impact of riots on the city following the assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr., April 4-8, 1968, as well as events and memorials in the city and vicinity, 1967-1968. Other images include figure and nude studies.

Images of New Haven primarily document locations in the city, including overhead views of the New Haven Green and city streets, particularly the intersection of Chapel Street and College Street, as well as images of the Yale University campus.
Many images show the interior of his rooms in Washington and New Haven, including his model airplanes, copy photographs of his calendar, and self-portraits.

controlaccess.subject: Riots -- Washington (D.C.) -- Pictorial works
controlaccess.geogname: New Haven Green (New Haven, Conn.) -- Pictorial works

did.unittitle: Negatives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: All images depict locations and events in Washington, District of Columbia, except where noted.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Negatives are arranged in the original order of the negative book.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: All negatives are 120 millimeter strips, except where noted, four negatives per strip.
Sleeve numbers 1-99 correspond to their original housing in the glassine sleeves of the negative book.
Strips for 120 millimeter negatives are housed one to a sleeve, some groups of 35 millimeter negative strips are housed in the same sleeve to retain the orginal numbering scheme of the negative book.
Dates for images are taken from inscriptions on the negative strips per a note in the collection by Lmanian. Other dates are derived from inscriptions on the glassine sleeves.

did.unittitle: Negatives from Negative Sleeve Book

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 1 (negatives): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies available. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Images that primarily document locations in New Haven, Connecticut, including overhead views of the New Haven Green and city streets, particularly the intersection of Chapel Street and College Street, as well as images of the Yale University campus. Many images show the interior of his room, including his model airplanes, copy photographs of his calendar, and self-portraits.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: All negatives 120 millimeter strips with usually three or four negatives per strip.
